revision.text:
{{Infobox Network Adapter |image1 = ALFA Network AWUS036H.jpg |image1_size = 100px |caption = 802.11b/g High Gain USB Wireless Long-Rang WiFi Network Adapter |caption2 = |pp = |sp = |dl = |wikidevi = |wikipedia = |brand = ALFA Network |model = AWUS036H |submodelappend = |submodel = |revision = |subrevision = |model_part_num = |page_start_date = |page_start_origon = |sernum = |wlclass = G54 |series = |if = USB |if_bus_version = 2.0 |ifconnector = Female Mini-B |formfactor = corded (modular) adapter |vendor_id = 0bda |device_id = 8187 |subvendor_id = |subdevice_id = |id_string = |windosid = |fcc_id = UQ2AWUS036H |icid = |boardid = |ecc_id = |oui = 00:C0:CA |chip1 = Realtek;RTL8187L; |chip2 = Realtek;RTL8225; |chip3 = |chip4 = |antconn = RP-SMA |antenna = |wirelessstand = IEEE 802.11b/g |802.11g = 54 |802.11b = 11 |wififreq = 2.4 |receive_sens = |transmit_power = |linuxdriv = |windriv = |is_manuf = No |manuf = |manuf_model = |manuf_rev = |addchip = |flags = high power |802dot11_protocols = bg |accessible_UART = No |accessible_JTAG = |category = |availability = |eoldate = |fccapprovdate = 04/30/2007 |estreldate = |price = |upc = |ean = 4718050300013 |dx_sku = |newegg = 9SIA8UD3805052 |asin = B000WXSO76 |asin_country = US |asin2 = |asin_country2 = |country = Taiwan |powledcolor = |connactled = |spdledcolor = |leddupcolor = |dimmin = |weight = }}{{TIDTOC|adapter}} ==Overview== [https://web.archive.org/web/20121122060920/https://www.alfa.com.tw/in/front/bin/ptdetail.phtml?Part=AWUS036H Product page] The FCC test report lists the max output power as 24.66 dBm (292.42mW) for 802.11b and 19.49 dBm (88.92mW) for 802.11g. EANs for this adapter seem to include 4718050300013 and 4718050300143. ===Revision info=== There are (at least) two separate revisions of this adapter. '''Revision 1''' was branded as a 500mW adapter and includes a 2dBi antenna. The maximum EIRP with the included antenna is approximately 500mW.
"JJ24UA Ver C 080710" is silkscreened on this board. It may be manufactured by '''JJPlus'''. :The date code on the below ''Rev1'' unit is '''0843''' (October 2008). The MAC of this particular unit is prefixed with '''00:C0:CA:1F'''. :'''Additional noted units''' :*[http://foro.seguridadwireless.net/adaptadores-wireless-usb/alfa-awus036h-1w/ Date code '''0741''' (October 2007), '''JJ24UA Ver A 061201''' and '''(=_=) Alex''' silkscreened on the board, '''Plotech''' PCB manuf.] :*[http://www.wifi-sistem.com/usb-wireless-adaptorler/1414-alfa-awus036h-500-mw-1000-mw-1watt-driver-guncellemesi.html Date code '''0917''' (April 2009), MAC prefix may be '''00:C0:CA:27'''] '''Revision 2''' is branded as a 1W adapter and includes a 5dBi antenna. The maximum EIRP with the included antenna (assuming the same output power as rev. 1) is approximately 1W. '''Accton''' would seem to be the manufacturer (presumably w/ an internal model of '''WUS2100-H''').
"P/N:141000000019W REV:R01" is silkscreened on the board. :The date code on the below ''Rev2'' unit is '''1015''' (April 2010). The MAC of this particular unit is prefixed with '''00:C0:CA:40'''. :Would appear to be using an [http://www.rfintc.com/ RFIC] [http://www.rfintc.com/pdf_file/AP1046V080812.pdf AP1046 PAM] An intermediate '''Accton''' / '''AWB''' manufactured unit (''Rev1.5'', to stick with the 1 for green and 2 for blue) [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8rXt98n2pcE visible on this '''YouTube''' video] may have also been sold. :The model noted on the board's label is '''WUS2100-3895''' (or something like that). The date code on the board is '''0949''' (December 2009). The MAC on the unit is prefixed with '''00:C0:CA:3E'''. ===Additional specifications=== The below information is per [http://www.bestpartner.pl/download/20835_st_eng.pdf this datasheet]. It isn't known which revision this was even targeted for.. and may be somewhat questionable, regardless.. 54Mbps and 48Mbps values also seem to have been reversed.. {{802dot11 RxSens|11b |info=PER < 0.08, nominal temps |1M=-96 |11M=-91 }} {{802dot11 RxSens|11g |info=PER < 0.10, nominal temps |6M=-91 |9M=-85 |12M=-82 |18M=-81 |24M=-80 |36M=-78 |48M=-76 |54M=-71 }} ==Links of Interest== ===Vendor links=== ====United States==== *[http://store.rokland.com/products/alfa-1000mw-usb-wireless-g-b-adapter-w-rp-sma-antenna-awus036h Product page] @ [http://store.rokland.com '''Rokland'''] *[http://www.data-alliance.net/servlet/-strse-73/Alfa-AWUS036H-1000mW-USB/Detail Product page] @ [http://www.data-alliance.net '''data-alliance'''] ====Europe==== *[http://wifi-gratuit.eu/fr/carte-alfa-1000mw/51-carte-wifi-alfa-awus036h-1000mw-antenne-5dbi-4718050301447.html Product page] @ [http://wifi-gratuit.eu/ '''Wifi-Gratuit.eu'''] *[http://www.alfanetworkeurope.eu/en/alfa-awus036h-80211g-wlan-high-power-usb-adapter-r.html Product page] @ [http://www.alfanetworkeurope.eu/en/ '''Alfa Network Europe'''] *[http://www.alfanetwork.no/AWUS036H-802e11g-WLAN-high-power-USB-Adapter-(Realtek--8187L)-Alfa-Network/cat-p/c1000028/p10500196 Product page] @ [http://www.alfanetwork.no/ '''Alfa Network Nordic A/S'''] *[http://alfanet.com.ua/p863060-alfa-network-awus036h.html Product page] @ [http://alfanet.com.ua/ '''Alfanet'''] ==Pictures==
